column5: Was on the ice again today with rob,   we managed to catch 8 in total once again, i hammered 5 small pike 5 different age class of pike too hahaah he managed a half deccent bucket another jumbo about 12 inches and a small hammer.  nothin major, kept my 5 alive in a live well all day for a day total pic and then let them go. we didnt keep a fish all day.    the hole that caught 7 of 8 fish yesterday caught 6 of 8 today, somekind of structure down there that the perch pike and bass seem to like. for 3 straight days now i've been leaving one line set in about 22 feet of water about 50 yards away from my other line lookin for a big slimer to come out from the depths, and still not a hit.  I've heard somebody say that persistance pays off so we'll see!  These lawn darts varied from 13-22 inches!
Great report and pics Matt  Another good day for you guys.... congratulations Got to love it when fish are active..... good job to both of you's Thanks for sharing Jacques
I think that you should take me fishing! lol
It's been a great 2 weeks for me Jaques non stop action!  Make your way down to North Bay Dan!   i can take ya out somewhere. all depends on what ya want to fish for!

Another fun day out on the lake forsure. Another bass to my surprise, still catching that mixed bag ya'll wish ya could HA. Back to back days, very similar fish, active times and weather. Lets hope this keeps up...and I will continue fishing everyday when really i should be out searchin  for a job lol!! Good times.Good fishin!
That a boy BassAsin, making team 6 proud. congrats, way to go.

its still early yet 10 and a half months to go and bass hasn't opened yet and neither have lakers or specks! as for wallies i hope i can beat last years 31 incher but i think percher can take care of that anyway!
good job you "Young Guns"!!!!  I'm proud to be on the team with you guys too, keep it up!  Man, I wish I could go fishing right now...

i'm a big fan of winter pike,,,, firm flesh..yummy!!!  matt ,, that's funny!! you are so right . one hole will produce all day when others within 6 feet get nodda.  i'm talkin' shallow ,, 6 to 8 ft. here.         6 guys ,,   2 holes per....   1 guy same bait gets 90% of the action.  just weird .   don't have an under-water camera to study why.

An underwater camera is exactly what i need its the same depth as holes 12 feet away but i'm thinking a down log, slab rock or a weed bed of sort that they follow the edge of.  in march just before ice off i'll have to submerge a water bottle on a rope and anchor and see what it is with a mask and snorkle!
thanks mike. nothing of great size but definatly a good day none the less!
